info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 04 at 2:56PM PDT until November 07 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM SUNDAY TO 4 AM PST MONDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT FOR THE WARNER MOUNTAINS... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible, with snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches possible and snowfall rates approaching 1 inch per hour. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...The Winter Storm Watch is for the Warner Mountains including portions of Highway 140 including Lakeview, Oregon and for Highway 299 including Cedar Pass. The Winter Weather Advisory is for most of Modoc County and Portions of Lake County, Oregon. This includes Alturas, Likely, Canby, Adin, and Tionesta, Summer Lake, Adel. Highways impacted include US Highway 395; California highways 139 and 299; and Oregon Highways 140, and 31. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 10 AM Sunday to 4 AM PST Monday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday afternoon through late Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on difficult to hazardous travel conditions due to snow and gusty winds. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snowfall will start from northwest and spread southeast. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com and http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
